headline: Teledyne FLIR OEM Debuts Tura Automotive-Qualified Thermal Camera at CES for AVs and ADAS
summary: LAS VEGAS & GOLETA, Calif., January 05, 2026--Teledyne FLIR OEM, a Teledyne Technologies Incorporated company (NYSE:TDY), today announced the launch of Tura™, the first Automotive Safety Integrity Level (ASIL-B) thermal longwave infrared (LWIR) camera developed in compliance with ISO 26262 functional safety (FuSa) standards. Tura is purpose-built to meet the stringent perception requirements for vehicle-based night vision, advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS), and autonomous vehicles (AV) t

content.title: Teledyne FLIR OEM Debuts Tura Automotive-Qualified Thermal Camera at CES for AVs and ADAS
content.summary: LAS VEGAS & GOLETA, Calif., January 05, 2026--Teledyne FLIR OEM, a Teledyne Technologies Incorporated company (NYSE:TDY), today announced the launch of Tura™, the first Automotive Safety Integrity Level (ASIL-B) thermal longwave infrared (LWIR) camera developed in compliance with ISO 26262 functional safety (FuSa) standards. Tura is purpose-built to meet the stringent perception requirements for vehicle-based night vision, advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS), and autonomous vehicles (AV) t

thumbnail.caption: Tura™ is the first Automotive Safety Integrity Level (ASIL-B) thermal longwave infrared (LWIR) camera developed in compliance with ISO 26262 functional safety (FuSa) standards. It is purpose-built to meet the stringent perception requirements for vehicle-based night vision, advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS), and autonomous vehicles (AV).

headline: Teledyne (TDY) Stock Trades Up, Here Is Why
summary: Shares of digital imaging and instrumentation provider Teledyne (NYSE:TDY) jumped 2.2% in the morning session after its subsidiary, Teledyne FLIR OEM, announced the launch of Tura, a new thermal camera designed for advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS) and autonomous vehicles (AVs).

content.title: Teledyne (TDY) Stock Trades Up, Here Is Why
content.summary: Shares of digital imaging and instrumentation provider Teledyne (NYSE:TDY) jumped 2.2% in the morning session after its subsidiary, Teledyne FLIR OEM, announced the launch of Tura, a new thermal camera designed for advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS) and autonomous vehicles (AVs).
